Medilink Admin Routes - Complete Documentation

Welcome to the Medilink Admin Routes documentation. This comprehensive guide covers all administrative features, API endpoints, and management operations for the Medilink Healthcare Management System.

Admin Routes Overview

The Medilink Admin Routes module provides complete administrative functionality including:

✅ Authentication & Security

  • Admin login and session management

  • Role-based access control

  • Secure password verification

✅ Dashboard & Analytics

  • System statistics and metrics

  • Doctor and patient counts

  • Appointment tracking

  • Medical records overview

✅ Doctor Management

  • List all doctors

  • Add new doctors

  • Edit doctor information

  • Delete (deactivate) doctors

✅ Patient Management

  • List all patients

  • Edit patient information

  • Delete (deactivate) patients

✅ Data Management

  • Complete CRUD operations

  • Soft delete for data integrity

  • Input validation and error handling

Getting Started

  1. Start Here: Read Medilink Admin Routes - Overview & Architecture for architecture overview

  2. Authentication: Follow Admin Authentication - Login & Session Management for login

  3. Dashboard: Explore Admin Dashboard - Statistics & Overview for statistics

  4. Management: Use Doctor Management - CRUD Operations and Patient Management - CRUD Operations

  5. API: Reference API Endpoints Reference - Complete Admin Routes for endpoint details

  6. Examples: Check Code Examples - Admin Integration for code samples

Key Metrics

  • Total Admin Routes: 9

  • Authentication Routes: 1 (Login)

  • Dashboard Routes: 1

  • Doctor Management Routes: 4 (List, Add, Edit, Delete)

  • Patient Management Routes: 3 (List, Edit, Delete)

System Requirements

  • Python 3.7+

  • Flask 3.0+

  • PyMySQL 1.1+

  • MySQL 5.7+

Support & Documentation

For issues or questions:

  1. Check Troubleshooting - Common Issues & Solutions for common solutions

  2. Review Code Examples - Admin Integration for implementation patterns

  3. Consult API Endpoints Reference - Complete Admin Routes for endpoint specifications

  4. Reference Admin Authentication - Login & Session Management for authentication details
